conversations.content: Happy Halloween, everyone! Now put on your best costume, because it's time for another fun holiday here at the Halidom!
WOOOO-HOOOO!
Trick or treat!
Trick or treat!
Sylaaaaas! Trick or treeeeat!
Yes, of course. Have a pumpkin cookie.
Yaaay! Thank you! And might I say, your costume is simply splendiferous!
It certainly is. What are you dressed as?
A researcher—er, or something. Honestly, this is the only costume-like outfit that I own.
I realize I should probably be dressed as a fiend or something more traditional, so I can change if this violates the rules.
Heh. I'm not wearing much of a traditional costume myself. All that matters is that you enjoy yourself in an outfit you like.
ARE you enjoying your Halloween so far?
To an extent.
Yes, well, I imagine you have many demands on your time as the organizer of this holiday, so there is no need to pay me any mind.
And Fleur, you should get back to your trick-or-treating before all of the sweets are gobbled up by Ranzal.
You bet I will! Happy Halloween, Sylas!
Well, just let me know if you need anything, all right? Goodbye, Sylas.
(Will participating in this Halloween festival really help me complete my healing aromatic?)
The day before the party...
I'm sorry, but I could not save him. Words cannot express my sorrow.
No apologies necessary. You're the reason my pappy was able to pass on peacefully and without pain.
Thank you again for those aromatics.
(It happened again...)
I've lost someone else...
(If I'd only finished my healing aromatic, I could have saved that man's father.)
(My research has allowed me to make aromatics that aid with a number of illnesses.)
(But there are still lives that slip through my fingers... My research is yet incomplete.)
Grandpa! Grandpa!
Thank you for everything, little Sylas... Be well...my child...
Grandpa? No! Don't die! GRANDPAAAA!
...I want to save people from suffering as my grandfather did.
But will I ever complete my healing aromatic if I continue at this rate?
Sorry, but did you just say something about healing aromatics?
Hmm?
I would love to hear more on the subject.
And who might you be?
Oh, merely an old physician with time on his hands. Now then, if you don't mind, I'm fascinated by this healing aromatic you were mentioning.
I never thought there might be other oddballs like myself who sought to cure illnesses through aromatherapy.
You know of this art?!
Oh my, yes! I've been researching it on my own for as long as I can remember. To think I'd meet a fellow scent scientist at this age. What a joyful day!
If I may ask, sir, have you by chance managed to perfect a healing aromatic?
And if I said yes?
Then you must tell me the recipe! Please, I beg you!
I cannot.
I'll pay whatever you ask!
Let me finish. I cannot tell you the recipe, but...
I can teach you the essence of it.
I don't understand.
You have clearly devoted your life to researching this miracle aromatic.
Were I to simply hand over my recipe, all your work would have been for nothing.
But if I show you the ESSENCE of my aromatic, you can use that as a jumping- off point for your own work.
(He is correct. If we combine the fruits of our research, we should be able to craft the perfect aromatic!)
In that case, Doctor, please permit me to serve as your apprentice.
Doctor, is it? Oh, but I DO like the sound of that. Now then, what is your name?
Sylas, sir.
Excellent. Well then, Sylas, today I will confer upon you the essence of the healing aromatic...
(Of all the things he could have told me in that moment, I never expected him to say that I should ＂enjoy Halloween.＂)
(If it's a hint, it is one beyond my ken. Yet I will not give up...)
I will come to understand the essence the doctor spoke of and finally complete the healing aromatic!
Is everything all right, my boy? I see you're still holed up in here.
It'd be a shame to waste a fine costume, so why not go out and enjoy the party?
I'm only participating in this tomfoolery so I can learn more about the healing aromatic. I cannot allow myself to get—
I thought I said you needed to ENJOY Halloween in order to understand.
Well, yes. You did. But, um...
You have no idea how to enjoy this holiday, do you?
Perhaps you should start by participating in a little prank or two.
I am no child, Doctor, and pranks are not the sort of thing someone my age should—
*cough* *hack* Wh-what in the world?!
SNEAK ATTACK! HA HA HA HA!
Knee-buckling strike is GOOOOO!
Not happening.
Bwuh?! I'm gonna faaall!
You okay, Luca?
Owww... C'mon, man, don't DODGE me! That's totally against the rules!
Anyone would dodge rather than subject themselves to one of your tricks.
Ha! Guess you ARE pretty used to this by now, huh, Sylas?
How many years do you think I've had to put up with pranks from the pair of you?
Dammit, fine.
But in that case, why not come out and pull a couple prank-a-roos with us?!
Absolutely not.
At least consider it!
Give up, Luca. Ol' Sylas here is stubborn as a mule in a molasses plant, so let's fall back and call another strategy sesh!
Roger that. And next time, we're gonna prank you good!
You're coming back? Ugh.
You see? There are some folks your age who retain an interest in ＂tomfoolery.＂
You should join—
NO!
Ugh. You never know when they'll show up with their horseplay.
Sylas! Shake my hand!
You mean the hand with paint on it?
Aw, boo! How'd you know?!
Pi... Pi... Pi...
PIPPLE!
Were you attempting to startle me?
Piiip?
If I'm not mistaken, there are more of these pranks popping up than ever.
Well, it IS Halloween. Also, you have a terrible reaction to these sorts of things.
That's because I constantly had to suffer though this nonsense when I was young.
From those two who came at you with that smoke-screened knee buckling? You grew up with them, I take it?
Doctor, I have to ask: How can pranking have anything whatsoever to do with the essence of a healing aromatic?
Perhaps you will understand if you properly face those who wish to prank you.
I think you should start by talking with these children here.
Well, that was less than helpful. ...Hmm?
There's a white ball rolling this way. Did somebody drop it?
Pssst! Look! He's gonna pick it up!
HE'S PICKING IT UP!
Is this...?!
GOTCHA! ...Oh, shoot.
I take it you are the owner of this?
Ha ha ha! Guess the cat's outta the bag. But you were pretty surprised, huh, mister?
Yes, it is a quite a fine replica of the human eyeball.
Sooo...you're not scared?
No. I was merely acting in an attempt to lure out the prankster. And here you are.
Man, I knew pranking you was gonna be tough, but sheesh!
What do you mean?
Everyone's sayin' that you're super tough to prank because not even Luca can get a good reaction out of you.
So we're having a contest to see who can get you to react first!
Ah, I see. That explains why these pranks have been increasing in number.
More importantly, have we met before?
Yeah! When I was sick, you helped me get better with your smell thingies!
Ah, now I remember! I barely recognized you, looking so hale and hearty.
It gladdens me to see you well enough to fool around like this.
All because of you, mister! I wanted to be sure and show you how much better I got.
And I thank you for it.
A word of advice though, if I may: If you are attempting to prank someone, you must learn to stay quiet.
Ha ha ha! Yeah...
Now then, here's a treat. Please enjoy your Halloween to the fullest.
Thanks, mister! You too!
Talking to that little scamp helped you see why they wanted to prank you, yes?
It did—but I fail to understand how it will bring me any closer to crafting the healing aromatic.
Sounds like someone still hasn't enjoyed himself to the fullest. Better move on to the next kind, then!
Wait a moment! The next kind of what?!
(Is ANY of this actually going to help me?)
And now you've taken me to the kitchen?
I have! Folks are terrifically busy making treats in here, and you should help out.
This seems more your style than pranking, don't you think?
You're certainly right about that.
Consider this another part of your studies. Go on now! Lend a hand!
Wait, but I—ACK!
Er, hello, Sylas. Did you need something?
As you can see, sir, we are quite occupied at the moment, so please make whatever business you have with us brief.
Right, well, I was hoping to help you make some of these treats. Er, I think?
That would be most appreciated. Come this way.
So then, what would you like me to make? Pumpkin cookies? Perhaps some tarts?
No, sir. I would like you to make...this!
B-b-bloody fingers?!
Indeed, this Flesh-of-the-Damned Cake with Bloody Sauce is a Halidom special.
Oh, and though they look like fingers, I guarantee they are merely sweets. There is no cause for alarm.
But won't this specialty of yours cause people to lose their appetites?
Not on Halloween, sir. Despite the morbid appearance, they're actually quite popular.
Here is the recipe—do not forget the strawberry sauce for the blood at the end. Best of luck.
The blood is...strawberry sauce?
Heh heh heh! What a fun surprise, no?
Anyone would be shocked to be served severed fingers on a plate.
I never thought something I loved could be cooked into something so...morbid.
Oh, but seeing someone as cool and collected as you be surprised IS a delight!
It reminds me of long ago...
What do you mean?
I once had a grandson who loved strawberries and was easily frightened, much like yourself.
While I love strawberries, I am no coward.
Are you sure? I have my doubts after seeing your reaction to the fingers!
That was just—
Please, sir. Less talking and more working.
R-right! Apologies! ...Although I wonder why I'm the only one in trouble here.
No one would count an old man like me as any kind of assistant.
Is that really all there is to it?
(Come to think of it, neither Cleo nor Edward mentioned the doctor.)
(It's unthinkable that they wouldn't greet a guest. Were they truly so busy that they overlooked him?)
Eeep!
Apologies, madam! I was deep in thought. Are you all right?
...Sylas? Is that you?
Oh! You're...
Yes, it's me! You were treating me with your aromatics up until last month!
Thanks to you, I've been able to sleep again and I'm fit as a fiddle!
I'm glad your insomnia has cleared up and you no longer have those deep bags under your eyes.
Right?! Now I can even dress up and come to fine parties like this one!
Oh, shoot! I was going to get another pumpkin. See you again soon, Sylas!
Doctor.
Yes, my boy?
I'm starting to get the impression that enjoying Halloween has nothing to do with creating a healing aromatic.
I met you the same day I was unable to help my patient.
Is all this just a ploy to raise my spirits after that loss?
If so, I appreciate the consideration, but do not require it.
You are half right.
I was not lying when I said that enjoying the Halloween season would help you discover the essence of the healing aromatic you seek.
Then please, tell me what Halloween has to do with—
Oh, look! It's the nice guy with all the smelly stuff!
Ah. You are...
It's been some time, Mister Sylas. Have you been keeping well?
You're the daughter of the woman who loved those yellow flowers.
Yes, and you helped us so much back then.
I don't know about that...
Oh, please don't look so sad.
Your aromatics saved us. They saved me, my daughter, AND my mother.
I...I see. I am glad to hear it.
Sylas, wait!
Where are you going? You made all those cakes and then bolted out of there!
I'm going back to my room. I don't have time to play around with whatever this is anymore.
People suffer while I'm out gallivanting around kitchens and whatnot, and I will not stand for it.
I must finish my healing aroma as soon as possible for their sakes.
And how much progress will you make when you're all worked up like this, mmm?
It doesn't matter. I must do this.
There are so many patients who could have been saved by now had I merely perfected my recipe!
So much time has passed since I began my research, and yet I'm no closer to a solution than when I started.
I had no right to face those two. Had I the healing aromatic, that woman's mother would yet live.
You're spiraling, my boy. Snap out of it.
Those two have moved on. What use is it to anyone if you refuse to do the same?
They came and showed you gratitude. Would you really cast that aside?
...I will be returning to my room now. Thank you for all you have taught me.
Just as stubborn as he always was...
How about these medicinal herbs... Oh, I've already tried mixing these.
Then next I'll try these aromatic herbs. The component list is...
Readyyy...
PRANKING REDUX! Trick or treat!
Oh, come on! NOTHING?!
It's Halloween, Sylas! Put down the books and beakers and science-y stuff and try to ENJOY yourself for once!
Seriously, if that frown was any more pronounced birds could land on it. You must be freaking out again, huh?
I AM NOT FREAKING OUT!
*sniff* Sorry for bothering you,  Mister Sylas...
Oh dear. No, lad. I'm the one who's sorry.
Oh, FINE! In that case, I suppose we'll just have to give you an extra-special,  never-before-seen treat from us.
A treat?
Yeah, a treat! You know, the thing that's not a trick? Anyway, here—we picked these 'cause we know you like strawberries.
You're pretty much acting like you do when you're at max capacity, so seriously try to take care of yourself, okay?
Yeah, what he said! Sometimes when you're all caught up in your own head, it's better to let loose and get it all out.
So if you ever get to a good stopping point, just come on out. Oh, and you've got this little fella waitin' for you too.
Don't push yourself too hard, Mister Sylas!
I made them all worry about me again. Oh, but I am pathetic.
Pathetic in every way.
Grandpa! Grandpa!
Thank you for everything, little Sylas... Be well...my child...
I've been researching so nobody would have to suffer as my grandfather did, and I swore that I would attain my goal no matter the cost.
But can someone as pathetic as me ever do what I set out to do?
I've worked late into the night again.
I'm sure the party's long over and I've hurt Luca and his friends' feelings.
Sylas? Are you there?
It's rather late for visitors...
Yes? Who is it?
Sorry to bother you at this hour, but this man—
You were working on some kind of healing aromatic, right?!
Please, you must use it to save my son! I beg you! I'll pay anything!
I'm listening. Please remain calm and tell me exactly what has transpired.
My son has been sick for some time, but his condition took a turn for the worse and the doctors have all but given up.
You're the only one I can count on now. Please, you must save my boy!
(CAN I save him?)
I'm sorry, but I could not save him. Words cannot express my sorrow.
No apologies necessary. You're the reason my pappy was able to pass on peacefully and without pain.
(What will I do if he gets his hopes up and I let another person down?)
Thank you for waiting. I have more oil right here.
No, that's all right. My mother... Well, she's passed.
(What if I lose someone again?)
Please! PLEASE!
Will you do it, Sylas?
I'm sorry, but I...
YOU DAMN FOOL!
Why are you hesitating?! They're waiting for you and your healing skills!
But my aromatic's not yet complete.
Do you remember the party? All those people you met? You've already saved countless lives!
And that's because you didn't give up!
So stop lingering on the dead and focus on those you've saved! Face forward, my boy!
For if you're so afraid of failure that you stop moving forward, you won't save anyone at all!
...You're right. I can't stand still.
I swore to keep improving until I complete my healing aromatic!
Take me to your son at once.
Zzz...
His breathing has calmed. I believe he will be okay.
Oh, thank you so much!
(I managed to save someone today. This is a happy occasion indeed.)
You were so against it at first, and yet here you are putting on a costume of your own volition. Have you finally changed your mind about Halloween?
Well, it IS the last day of the party. And besides, he asked me to.
And who might this mysterious ＂he＂ be?
Mister Sylas!
Easy now! You're still not all better yet, so no running!
I have no idea how to thank you, sir.
Oh, there's no need. I'm simply glad he's recovered enough to enjoy the festivities with the rest of us.
I truly can't thank you enough.
Thank you, Mister Sylas! I'm so excited I get to be at the Halloween party!
I'm glad to hear it.
Oh, and...trick or treat!
Actually, I do have a treat for you. But sadly, it isn't candy.
Huh? Candles?
Candy would be a bit much for you right now, so I've prepared scented candles that smell like sweet treats instead.
These smell like candy?!
Yes. Try to just enjoy the scent for now, and then when you're better you can have all the sweets you want.
Okay. Thanks, Mister Sylas!
We'll be on our way now.
Have a wonderful Halloween.
Seems like someone's soft on kids.
It's not that.
Oh, pishposh! No need to be defensive.
More importantly, you've saved yet another life.
...I think I understand why you told me to enjoy Halloween now.
Oh? And why might that be?
Halloween was an excuse to get me to interact with my former patients.
Knowing they were saved by my aromatics gave me the strength I needed to defeat the powerlessness I felt.
That's what you were after, Doctor. Wasn't it?
So you finally realized it.
The path to completing your healing aromatic will not be an easy one, my boy.
In the course of your research, you will come to know even more death—and with your kind nature, this will likely make you curse your own powerlessness.
When that happens, I want you to remember all of the smiles you saw during this party.
Your aromatics have already saved lives. You are making progress, even if it's only a little at a time.
You've long ago learned how to turn your sadness into strength.
So from now on, try to gain strength from the happiness of those you've saved.
Can I really do that?
You can, for that is the essence of the perfect healing aromatic you seek.
Thank you for all you've taught me, Doctor.
I will forever remember your lessons as I continue my research.
That straightforwardness and diligence of yours is the same as it ever was.
So please don't let the memory of my death hold you back any longer, little Sylas.
What? Doctor, what did you—
Gueeess WHO?!
Wha—?! Luca! Laranoa! Let go of me! I must finish talking to the doctor!
...Wait. Where did he go?
Aw, boo! He figured us out right away. Guess I'll have to work on changing my voice up a bit.
Don't go covering someone's eyes when they're in the middle of a conversation!
You were talking to someone?
Yes, the doctor! The old human who was standing right next to me!
Uh, you've been alone since the moment we spotted you, dude.
What...? But what about the doctor?
I once had a grandson who loved strawberries and was easily frightened, much like yourself.
So please don't let the memory of my death hold you back any longer, little Sylas.
No... Could it be...? *sniff*
Whoa, Sylas! You're crying!
*sniff* I don't care if it's Halloween. That kind of prank isn't funny at all.
Oh, Grandfather...
You know what? I bet that really WAS your grandfather, Sylas.
I don't know how you could actually believe such an absurd story...
Yeah, but I do! You too, right, Luca?
Hey, there's no way those tears were fake! That's all the proof I need.
And besides, it IS Halloween.
What does that have to do with it?
Halloween ain't just some harvest festival.
It's also the day when the dead come to visit the living.
I bet your gramps was worried about you.
So it would seem—but I won't make him worry about me ever again.
For my grandfather has taught me the key to completing the healing aromatic.
What I don't get is why he chose to take a human form.
Maybe he just wanted to surprise Sylas. I mean, it wouldn't be fun if he just came to visit like normal on Halloween, yeah?
That could indeed be the case. Unlike me, my grandfather always enjoyed games.
So your grandpa gave you both a trick  AND a treat? He's good at this!
Indeed, I would say he was even better than you two when it came to pranks.
No way!
Oh, we are NOT taking that lying down.
Well, if it bothers you that much, why don't you show me how to do it?
Huh?
I'm going to take a break from my research tonight so I can enjoy Halloween.
And there are a bunch of prankster kids out there who need a little bit of payback. So what do you say?
Oh, you KNOW we're in!
Yeah! Now let's storm this party!
I will bestow happiness upon everyone!
(You can rest easy, Grandfather—I won't let my sadness overwhelm me ever again.)
(And I won't give up until my healing aromatic is complete!)
